21.description: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is used for transferring files between a client and server on a network.

22.description: Secure Shell (SSH) is a cryptographic network protocol used for secure communication over an unsecured network.

23.description: Telnet is a network protocol used to provide text-oriented communications between a client and a server.

25.description: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is an internet standard for email transmission.

53.description: Domain Name System (DNS) is a hierarchical and decentralized naming system for computers, services, or other resources connected to the Internet.

80.description: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web.

110.description: Post Office Protocol version 3 (POP3) is a standard mail protocol used to receive emails from a remote server to a local email client.

123.description: Network Time Protocol (NTP) is used to synchronize the clocks of computers over a network.

135.description: Microsoft Remote Procedure Call (RPC) is a protocol that one program can use to request a service from a program located on another computer in a network.

137.description: NetBIOS Name Service provides a way to manage NetBIOS name resolution used by clients on the same network.

138.description: NetBIOS Datagram Service allows NetBIOS names to be resolved into IP addresses.

139.description: NetBIOS Session Service provides a way for applications to create sessions with each other.

143.description: Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) is an internet standard protocol used by email clients to retrieve email messages from a mail server over a TCP/IP connection.

161.description: Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) is an internet standard protocol used to manage and monitor network devices.

443.description: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is an extension of HTTP that is used for secure communication over a computer network.

445.description: Server Message Block (SMB) is a network file sharing protocol.

465.description: SMTPS (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol Secure) is a variant of SMTP with TLS encryption.

514.description: Syslog is a protocol used for forwarding log messages in an IP network.

587.description: SMTP (Mail Submission) is a protocol used for email transmission.

993.description: IMAPS (Internet Message Access Protocol Secure) is an extension of IMAP that operates over SSL/TLS.

995.description: POP3S (Post Office Protocol 3 Secure) is an extension of POP3 that operates over SSL/TLS.

1433.description: Microsoft SQL Server is a relational database management system developed by Microsoft.

1521.description: Oracle Database is a multi-model database management system developed by Oracle Corporation.

3306.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

3389.description: Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) is a proprietary protocol developed by Microsoft for remote access to Windows-based systems.

5432.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source object-relational database system.

5900.description: Virtual Network Computing (VNC) is a graphical desktop-sharing system that uses the Remote Frame Buffer protocol to remotely control another computer.

27017.description: MongoDB is a cross-platform document-oriented database program.

50000.description: SAP NetWeaver Application Server is the foundation of the SAP NetWeaver platform.
